# Draft:List of United Kingdom prime ministerial firsts

----
The following lists achievements and distinctions of various Prime Ministers of the United Kingdom. It includes distinctions achieved in their earlier life and post-prime ministerial activities.
Robert Walpole (1721–1742)
* First person to be prime minister of the United Kingdom.
* First prime minister to be a Whig.
Spencer Compton (1742–1743)
Henry Pelham (1743–1754)
Thomas Pelham-Holles (1754–1756, 1757-1762)
William Cavendish (1756–1757)
John Stuart (1762–1763)
* First prime minister to be a Tory.
George Grenville (1763–1765)
Charles Watson Wentworth (1765–1766, 1782)
William Pitt, the Elder (1766–1768)
Augustus Henry Fitzroy (1768–1770)
Frederick North (1770–1782)
William Petty-Fitzmaurice (1782–1783)
William Henry Cavendish-Bentinck (1783, 1807-1809)
William Pitt, the Younger (1783–1801, 1804-1806)
Henry Addington (1801–1804)
William Wyndham Grenville (1806–1807)
Spencer Perceval (1809–1812)
Robert Banks Jenkinson (1812–1827)
* First prime minister to be from the Conservative Party (UK).
George Canning (1827)
Frederick John Robinson (1827–1828)
Arthur Wellesley (1828–1830, 1834)
* First prime minister to be born in Ireland.
Charles Grey (1830–1834)
William Lamb (1834, 1835-1841)
Robert Peel (1834–35, 1841-1846)
John Russell (1846–1852, 1865-1866)
Edward Geoffrey Stanley (1852, 1858-1859, 1866-1868)
George Hamilton-Gordon (1852–1855)
Henry John Temple (1855–1858, 1859-1865)
Benjamin Disraeli (1868, 1874-1880)
William Ewart Gladstone (1868–1874, 1880-1885, 1886, 1892-1894)
Robert Cecil (1885–1886, 1886-1892, 1895-1902)
Archibald Philip Primrose (1894–1895)
Arthur James Balfour (1902–1905)
Henry Campbell-Bannerman (1905–1908)
H.H. Asquith (1908–1916)
David Lloyd George (1916–1922)
* First prime minister born in the 19th century.
* First prime minister from Wales.
Andrew Bonar Law (1922–1923)
* First prime minister born in Canada.
Stanley Baldwin (1923–1924, 1924-1929, 1935-1937)
Ramsay Macdonald (1924, 1929-1935)
* First prime minister from the Labour Party (UK).
Neville Chamberlain (1937–1940)
Winston Churchill (1940–1940, 1951-1955)
* First prime minister to serve under Elizabeth II.
* First prime minister to accept the Order of the Garter during the reign of Elizabeth II.
* First prime minister to visit Iceland while in office.
Clement Attlee (1945–1951)
Anthony Eden (1955–1957)
Harold Macmillan (1957–1963)
* First prime minister to visit Jamaica while in office.
Alec Douglas-Home (1963–1964)
Harold Wilson (1964–70, 1974-1976)
Edward Heath (1970–1974)
* First prime minister to visit Japan while in office.
James Callaghan (1976–1979)
Margaret Thatcher (1979–1990)
* First female prime minister of the United Kingdom.
* First prime minister to visit China, Hungary, Malaysia, South Korea, Israel, Spain and Poland while in office.
John Major (1990–1997)
* First prime minister to visit Colombia while in office.
Tony Blair (1997–2007)
* First prime minister born during the reign of Elizabeth II.
* First prime minister to choose to live in the flat above 11 Downing Street, instead of living in the flat above 10 Downing Street.
* First prime minister from the Labour Party (UK) to win three consecutive elections (Blair and Labour won the 1997, 2001, and 2005 general elections).
* First prime minister to have been formally questioned by police while in office.
* First prime minister to visit Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, Syria, Libya, Slovakia and Lebanon while in office.
* First prime minister to visit Chicago.
Gordon Brown (2007–2010)
* First prime minister to visit Chile while in office.
David Cameron (2010–2016)
* First prime minister to visit Myanmar, Algeria, Kazakhstan, and Vietnam while in office.
Theresa May (2016–2019)
* First prime minister to suffer Diabetes.
Boris Johnson (2019–2022)
* First prime minister born in the United States (New York City).
* First prime minister to have a female predecessor and successor (Theresa May and Liz Truss, respectively).
Liz Truss (2022)
* First prime minister to serve under Charles III.
* First prime minister to appoint no white male for the Great Offices of State; appointing James Cleverly as foreign secretary, Suella Braverman as home secretary, and Kwasi Kwarteng as chancellor of the exchequer.
Rishi Sunak (2022–2024)
* First British Asian to become prime minister.
* First prime minister to be a Hindu.
* First prime minister to be appointed by Charles III.
* First prime minister to visit Moldova while in office.
Keir Starmer (since 2024)
* First prime minister to appoint a female Chancellor of the Exchequer (Rachel Reeves).
* First prime minister to visit Samoa and Azerbaijan while in office.
* First Prime Minister to address the European Council since the UK left the European Union.
